definition: middle game (in go or chess)/(share trading) mid-session/(abbr. for 中盤商|中盘商[zhong1 pan2 shang1]) distributor/wholesaler/middleman
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)

plate/dish/tray/board/hard drive (computing)/to build/to coil/to check/to examine/to transfer (property)/to make over/classifier for food: dish, helping/to coil/classifier for coils of wire/classifier for games of chess

sentences.english: The companies appreciate being a bigger fish in a smaller pond.
sentences.chinese: 这些小盘和中盘股公司很感谢能成为小池塘中的大鱼。

sentences.english: The snake coiled itself up in the cave.
sentences.chinese: 那条蛇在洞穴中盘成一团。

definition: see 蓮花落|莲花落[lian2 hua1 lao4]
to move/to shift/to move out of the way/to divert (money etc) to a different purpose
chess/chess-like game/a game of chess/CL:盤|盘[pan2]/chess piece/CL:個|个[ge4],顆|颗[ke1]

plate/dish/tray/board/hard drive (computing)/to build/to coil/to check/to examine/to transfer (property)/to make over/classifier for food: dish, helping/to coil/classifier for coils of wire/classifier for games of chess
ancient name for go (Chinese board game)
draw or tie in chess etc/CL:盤|盘[pan2]
to spin rapidly/to whirl around/(of time) to fly by
to shake up/to jolt/to vibrate/to oscillate/to fluctuate
sports such as soccer, basketball and volleyball that use large balls/see also 小球[xiao3 qiu2]
